adminTagsLike.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving specific entries. It should include only one string to search for in entry tags set by an ADMIN user (no wildcards, spaces are treated as part of the string).

adminTagsMultiLikeAnd.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving specific entries. It could include few (comma separated) strings for searching in entry tags, set by an ADMIN user, while applying an AND logic to retrieve entries that contain all input strings (no wildcards, spaces are treated as part of the string).

adminTagsMultiLikeOr.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving specific entries. It could include few (comma separated) strings for searching in entry tags, set by an ADMIN user, while applying an OR logic to retrieve entries that contain at least one input string (no wildcards, spaces are treated as part of the string).

createdAtGreaterThanOrEqual.description: This filter parameter should be in use for retrieving only entries which were created at Kaltura system after a specific time/date (standard timestamp format).

createdAtLessThanOrEqual.description: This filter parameter should be in use for retrieving only entries which were created at Kaltura system before a specific time/date (standard timestamp format).

idEqual.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving only a specific entry (identified by its entryId).

idIn.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving few specific entries (string should include comma separated list of entryId strings).

nameEqual.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving entries with a specific name.

nameLike.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving specific entries. It should include only one string to search for in entry names (no wildcards, spaces are treated as part of the string).

nameMultiLikeAnd.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving specific entries. It could include few (comma separated) strings for searching in entry names, while applying an AND logic to retrieve entries that contain all input strings (no wildcards, spaces are treated as part of the string).

nameMultiLikeOr.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving specific entries. It could include few (comma separated) strings for searching in entry names, while applying an OR logic to retrieve entries that contain at least one input string (no wildcards, spaces are treated as part of the string).

partnerIdIn.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving only entries within Kaltura network which were uploaded by/assigned to users of few Kaltura Partners  (string should include comma separated list of PartnerIDs)

searchTextMatchAnd.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving specific entries while search match the input string within all of the following metadata attributes: name, description, tags, adminTags.

searchTextMatchOr.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving specific entries while search match the input string within at least one of the following metadata attributes: name, description, tags, adminTags.

tagsMultiLikeAnd.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving specific entries. tagsMultiLikeOr.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving specific entries. parameters.description: The format of the response
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: All entries within this categoy or in child categories
parameters.name: entryFilter[categoryAncestorIdIn]

parameters.description: The id of the original entry
parameters.name: entryFilter[redirectFromEntryId]

parameters.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving only a specific entry (identified by its entryId).
parameters.name: entryFilter[idEqual]

parameters.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving few specific entries (string should include comma separated list of entryId strings).
parameters.name: entryFilter[idIn]

parameters.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving specific entries. It should include only one string to search for in entry names (no wildcards, spaces are treated as part of the string).
parameters.name: entryFilter[nameLike]

parameters.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving specific entries. It could include few (comma separated) strings for searching in entry names, while applying an OR logic to retrieve entries that contain at least one input string (no wildcards, spaces are treated as part of the string).
parameters.name: entryFilter[nameMultiLikeOr]

parameters.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving specific entries. It could include few (comma separated) strings for searching in entry names, while applying an AND logic to retrieve entries that contain all input strings (no wildcards, spaces are treated as part of the string).
parameters.name: entryFilter[nameMultiLikeAnd]

parameters.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving entries with a specific name.
parameters.name: entryFilter[nameEqual]

parameters.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving only entries which were uploaded by/assigned to users of a specific Kaltura Partner (identified by Partner ID).
parameters.name: entryFilter[partnerIdEqual]

parameters.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving only entries within Kaltura network which were uploaded by/assigned to users of few Kaltura Partners  (string should include comma separated list of PartnerIDs)
parameters.name: entryFilter[partnerIdIn]

parameters.description: This filter parameter should be in use for retrieving only entries, uploaded by/assigned to a specific user (identified by user Id).
parameters.name: entryFilter[userIdEqual]

parameters.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving specific entries. It should include only one string to search for in entry tags (no wildcards, spaces are treated as part of the string).
parameters.name: entryFilter[tagsLike]

parameters.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving specific entries. It could include few (comma separated) strings for searching in entry tags, while applying an OR logic to retrieve entries that contain at least one input string (no wildcards, spaces are treated as part of the string).
parameters.name: entryFilter[tagsMultiLikeOr]

parameters.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving specific entries. It could include few (comma separated) strings for searching in entry tags, while applying an AND logic to retrieve entries that contain all input strings (no wildcards, spaces are treated as part of the string).
parameters.name: entryFilter[tagsMultiLikeAnd]

parameters.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving specific entries. It should include only one string to search for in entry tags set by an ADMIN user (no wildcards, spaces are treated as part of the string).
parameters.name: entryFilter[adminTagsLike]

parameters.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving specific entries. It could include few (comma separated) strings for searching in entry tags, set by an ADMIN user, while applying an OR logic to retrieve entries that contain at least one input string (no wildcards, spaces are treated as part of the string).
parameters.name: entryFilter[adminTagsMultiLikeOr]

parameters.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving specific entries. It could include few (comma separated) strings for searching in entry tags, set by an ADMIN user, while applying an AND logic to retrieve entries that contain all input strings (no wildcards, spaces are treated as part of the string).
parameters.name: entryFilter[adminTagsMultiLikeAnd]

parameters.description: All entries within these categories or their child categories.
parameters.name: entryFilter[categoriesMatchOr]

parameters.description:
All entries of the categories, excluding their child categories.
	 To include entries of the child categories, use categoryAncestorIdIn, or categoriesMatchOr.
parameters.name: entryFilter[categoriesIdsMatchOr]

parameters.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving only entries, at a specific {
parameters.name: entryFilter[statusEqual]

parameters.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving only entries, not at a specific {
parameters.name: entryFilter[statusNotEqual]

parameters.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving only entries, at few specific {
parameters.name: entryFilter[statusIn]

parameters.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving only entries, not at few specific {
parameters.name: entryFilter[statusNotIn]

parameters.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving entries of few {
parameters.name: entryFilter[typeIn]

parameters.description: This filter parameter should be in use for retrieving only entries which were created at Kaltura system after a specific time/date (standard timestamp format).
parameters.name: entryFilter[createdAtGreaterThanOrEqual]

parameters.description: This filter parameter should be in use for retrieving only entries which were created at Kaltura system before a specific time/date (standard timestamp format).
parameters.name: entryFilter[createdAtLessThanOrEqual]

parameters.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving specific entries while search match the input string within all of the following metadata attributes: name, description, tags, adminTags.
parameters.name: entryFilter[searchTextMatchAnd]

parameters.description: This filter should be in use for retrieving specific entries while search match the input string within at least one of the following metadata attributes: name, description, tags, adminTags.
parameters.name: entryFilter[searchTextMatchOr]

get.description:
Will write to the event log a single line representing the event
	 client version - will help interprete the line structure. different client versions might have slightly different data/data formats in the line
event_id - number is the row number in yuval's excel
datetime - same format as MySql's datetime - can change and should reflect the time zone
session id - can be some big random number or guid
partner id
entry id
unique viewer
widget id
ui_conf id
uid - the puser id as set by the ppartner
current point - in milliseconds
duration - milliseconds
user ip
process duration - in milliseconds
control id
seek
new point
referrer
	
	
	 KalturaStatsEvent $event

parameters.description: The format of the response
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: the client's timestamp of this event
parameters.name: event[eventTimestamp]

parameters.description: a unique string generated by the client that will represent the client-side session: the primary component will pass it on to other components that sprout from it
parameters.name: event[sessionId]

parameters.description: the UV cookie - creates in the operational system and should be passed on ofr every event
parameters.name: event[uniqueViewer]

parameters.description: the partner's user id
parameters.name: event[userId]

parameters.description: the timestamp along the video when the event happend
parameters.name: event[currentPoint]

parameters.description: the duration of the video in milliseconds - will make it much faster than quering the db for each entry
parameters.name: event[duration]

parameters.description: the time in milliseconds the event took
parameters.name: event[processDuration]

parameters.description: the id of the GUI control - will be used in the future to better understand what the user clicked
parameters.name: event[controlId]

parameters.description: true if the user ever used seek in this session
parameters.name: event[seek]

parameters.description: timestamp of the new point on the timeline of the video after the user seeks
parameters.name: event[newPoint]

parameters.description: the referrer of the client
parameters.name: event[referrer]

parameters.description: will indicate if the event is thrown for the first video in the session
parameters.name: event[isFirstInSession]

parameters.description: kaltura application name
parameters.name: event[applicationId]

get.description:
Creates new download job for multiple entry ids (comma separated), an email will be sent when the job is done
	 This sevice support the following entries: 
	 - MediaEntry
	 - Video will be converted using the flavor params id
	 - Audio will be downloaded as MP3
	 - Image will be downloaded as Jpeg
	 - MixEntry will be flattened using the flavor params id
	 - Other entry types are not supported
	 Returns the admin email that the email message will be sent to

parameters.description: The format of the response
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: Comma separated list of entry ids
parameters.name: entryIds
